sections.purpose: To accurately administer oral doses to experimental animals.
sections.scope: Applicable to oral drug administration studies.
procedure: Select the syringe size appropriate for the animal and dose volume.
Draw up the exact dose volume into the syringe.
Restrain the animal gently and insert the gavage needle into the esophagus.
Slowly administer the dose while monitoring swallowing.
Remove the syringe and observe the animal for any adverse reactions.
Record the dose administered, time, and route.
Clean and sterilize the syringe for reuse.
precautions: Ensure the needle length is appropriate for the animal size.
Avoid forcing the needle to prevent esophageal trauma.
Use positive pressure technique to prevent aspiration.
Monitor for signs of respiratory distress.
